situation: J became agitated in the brightly lit art room when the fluorescent lights flickered.
action: The teacher aide continued with the activity instructions, telling J to ignore the lights as they came back on shortly.
effect: J couldn’t concentrate on his task, continuing to express distress and discomfort, which led to him leaving the room.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
